snippet: The Supreme Court will hear challenges on Wednesday to a 2007 law limiting anti-abortion campaigners from communicating with women entering clinics, which they contend infringes on their rights.
abstract: Supreme Court will review 2007 Massachusetts law barring anti-abortion protesters from coming within 35 feet of abortion clinics, hearing free speech complaint brought by campaigner Eleanor McCullen; court has become significantly more conservative since it upheld similar Colorado law in 2000.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court will hear challenges on Wednesday to a 2007 law limiting anti-abortion campaigners from communicating with women entering clinics, which they contend infringes on their rights.

headline.main: Where Free Speech Collides With Abortion Rights
headline.print_headline: Where Free Speech Collides With Abortion Rights
